title: Mid Year Mage Updates - Vladimir Direction
body:
You know what time it is!

[it’s Vladimir’s direction post time!]

With all the other mage posts coming out, you probably already know what to expect here, so let’s dive right in: What sorts of things are we looking to do with our Crimson Reaper? Off the bat, we’ve heard you and we strongly agree that his sustain is what sets him apart both strategically and thematically, and we’re looking to keep it that way. With that out of the way, let’s get a little more specific:

We’re not likely to change:

* Sustain -- Vladimir is the best sustainer in his class and likely the best in the game (Mundo might take that one).
* Health costs -- Risk management in the form of his own HP bar has always been core to Vladimir, and we’d like to reinforce that.
* Stat Affinity -- Vlad has always been the AP + HP guy, and we think that’s pretty cool.
* Q Targeting -- Not everything has to be a skill shot, and we think retaining the old paradigm here is important to the spell’s feel.
* Strengths / Weaknesses -- Vlad is the Mage who can out sustain low-damage foes but falls to teams with reliable gap-closing and burst damage.
* Sanguine Pool -- An iconic ability that should be preserved.

We’re looking to improve:

* Stack management -- We like the cerebral health cost management aspects of E, but we do not like the resulting unintuitive upkeep game.
* Binary matchups -- Vlad is sometimes thought of as the king of stat checks, leaving his opponents (and often himself) with few options other than ‘be stronger,’ and that’s not a reputation anyone wants. A lot of this comes from unclear windows of strength and weakness (they exist, but are difficult to perceive), so a lot of our work will be in exposing those.
* Counterplay -- Closely related to the above point, Vladimir’s opponents often feel there’s nothing they can do to avoid his damage once in range of him. 
* Satisfaction -- Mostly looking at E here (‘Tides of Blood’ inspires a much more powerful image than the current E delivers on, and we’d like to change that), though there’s a few other areas that can feel better. TLDR; Needs blood. MORE BLOOD.

When we’re done:

* Vladimir’s kit should feel very familiar, and his overall strategy will be largely unchanged!
* Vladimir’s windows of strength and weakness will be clearer to both himself and the opponent, giving everyone an increased understanding of how he succeeds or fails and allowing him to plan and set up plays.
* Vladimir will continue to deal loads of DPS and heal buckets of HP, but in more satisfying and less diffuse ways.

Anddd that about sums it up! I know I’ve been pretty abstract here, so please ask any question you may have -- we’re not through with all the nitty gritty details on our end yet, so I may not have all the answers you’re looking for, but I can definitely share our thoughts and the relevant guiding principles. Also, and most importantly, if any of the above breaks your expectations of what Vladimir is or should be, now’s definitely the time to let us know!

Alright, that’s it from me for now but I’ll be around over the next couple days! See ya then,

-Stashu

replies.body:
I definitely agree Tides of Blood feels lackluster. It's just something you tap every once in a while to make sure your spells will heal you more and to make that creep wave disappear. Anything you can add to your plans for that specific spell? I would expect health management to become a larger part of his kit, right now it's a minor issue until level 9, when it's completely eradicated from play through Transfusion's heal.

You mentioned more blood, I think all of his skills require more blood. He _is_ the Sanguine Sorcerer, after all.

> [{quoted}](name=Gunslinger744,realm=EUW,application-id=A7LBtoKc,discussion-id=OJQBsbEM,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2016-03-04T22:35:04.750+0000)
>
> I definitely agree Tides of Blood feels lackluster. It's just something you tap every once in a while to make sure your spells will heal you more and to make that creep wave disappear. Anything you can add to your plans for that specific spell? I would expect health management to become a larger part of his kit, right now it's a minor issue until level 9, when it's completely eradicated from play through Transfusion's heal.
> 
> You mentioned more blood, I think all of his skills require more blood. He _is_ the Sanguine Sorcerer, after all.

Sure thing -- We're looking to make it more of a risky ante *in the moment,* rather than over 4-5 casts. We want Vlad to be thinking 'how much health can I afford to pay RIGHT NOW?' and we want the ability to enable him to pay a LOT if he wants to, or a little if he doesn't/can't, offering him a proportional reward to the amount spent.

What if instead of running off of stacks, Tides of Blood was a charging ability, similar to a Varus or Xerath Q? The longer held, the more health cost, but more damage in an area around him. This duration could also affect his self healing for a short period of time if that was a feature you wanted to keep in his kit. I think that a change like this would certainly make using the ability FEEL better to use, but I'm not sure how well it would work out in practice.

I like this but with one tweak;
Increase the _range_ of the ability as it charges (instead of its damage). Then give Vlad increased healing based on the number of targets hit.
I don't have enough upvotes for this idea. Rito pls.

> [{quoted}](name=Riot Stashu,realm=NA,application-id=A7LBtoKc,discussion-id=OJQBsbEM,comment-id=00030000,timestamp=2016-03-04T22:51:19.911+0000)
>
> Sure thing -- We're looking to make it more of a risky ante *in the moment,* rather than over 4-5 casts. We want Vlad to be thinking 'how much health can I afford to pay RIGHT NOW?' and we want the ability to enable him to pay a LOT if he wants to, or a little if he doesn't/can't, offering him a proportional reward to the amount spent.

Wow, this sounds super promising
What are your directions with spell vamp and his spellvamp afinity since you pointed "stat afinity"?

Oh boy... this is the thing of my nightmares at the moment. I love that Vlad is 'the spellvamp guy.' It's very thematic and is pretty unique to him. But...

It's tough to make a damaging ability with a health cost when spell vamp exists, as the healthcost quickly fades to irrelevance (especially AoE spells in minion waves!) That said, we do not *want* to remove spellvamp, and we want Vlad's spells to do damage and cost health, so we're going to have to find some clever solutions here. 

Currently, for example, we're exploring reducing vamp's effectiveness on minions, but this is just one of the many stabs we're taking at trying to get these things to coexist.

Well, the release of Jhin certainly proved you guys are completely capable of and willing to make exceptions using insane math equations. That alone opened up windows for options :D

What if you added a condition to Vlad's passive that spellvamp on his kit instead fills a secondary resource bar, similar to Aatrox? And his spells that cost health would instead draw from this "pool" before his own health, because he's using his enemy's blood to fuel his power instead of sacrificing his own?

Spellvamp suddenly becomes much less of a sustain resource on Vlad. Sure, maybe if he gets ahead, he can cut down on the health costs of his spells, but that's nothing special. A snowballing Aatrox or Mundo do the exact same thing. And if the pool itself provides no defensive value, no "second health pool" to block damage with, then spellvamp becomes _offensive_ sustain only, with no _defensive_ benefits to speak of.

The value here becomes twofold:

-You don't have to balance spellvamp around the one problem case that uses it (I wish you guys would make Iceborne Gauntlet melee only so you don't have to balance THAT around the problem case of Ezreal)

-You can much more easily balance Vlad's sustain vs cost numbers, as you directly control precisely how much sustain he has independent of every other mage.

Can't up-vote this enough, I feel like this is a great idea, it also gives him a feasible direction as to how to build. However, I think the premise of buying Spell Vamp as a whole is a fairly defensive idea, the problem with it is the amount that Vladimir abuses it, so what if they simply reduced the effectiveness of Spell Vamp as a whole on Vladimir, say a 60% reduction, so that it still gives him some sustain, otherwise champions that already kick his ass early game *cough* {{champion:92}}  *cough* won't dominate him due to the lack of his ability to sustain the high damage trades.

You could then use a secondary resource bar that is filled with the blood he takes from enemy champs (remember that 60% reduction? Have it fill this) and use that to amp his spells in different ways. It'd be similar to a Renekton rage bar mechanic, where the higher it is, the less prone you should be to trying to fight him without buying him dinner first. You could balance it by filling this only with the Spell Vamp from champs, that way he doesn't just Q a minion and then proceed to murder you under your tower.

I love the idea that he uses his opponents blood to feed his spells. I think that it would be a fantastically unique mechanic for a very unique champion and it'd make it so Vladimir actually is out-playable instead of just "stay the hell out of his range or burst him".

TL;DR you deserve more upvotes sir. {{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}

Spell vamp in general, or just for Vlad?

It's already a lot harder for mages to get spell vamp and heal themselves up than it is for AD champions to grab lifesteal.

> [{quoted}](name=Nameless Voice,realm=EUW,application-id=A7LBtoKc,discussion-id=OJQBsbEM,comment-id=000a00000000,timestamp=2016-03-04T23:26:33.272+0000)
>
> Spell vamp in general, or just for Vlad?
> 
> It's already a lot harder for mages to get spell vamp and heal themselves up than it is for AD champions to grab lifesteal.

This has been the big question for me since I first heard about these reworks. Spellvamp should be a viable option for any sustained damage mage, but isn't because Vladimir exists. Is it possible these changes will put Vlad in a state that spellvamp can be viably bought on more than two champions?
That's 100% the plan.

> [{quoted}](name=Riot Stashu,realm=NA,application-id=A7LBtoKc,discussion-id=OJQBsbEM,comment-id=000a0000000000000000,timestamp=2016-03-04T23:43:14.911+0000)
>
> That's 100% the plan.

This makes me incredibly happy, I really hope it comes through.
Thank you!

I personally feel like it's a bit of a cop-out to keep Q very intact. The spell is one of the core reasons why Vlad feels so stat-checky to fight. It's simply not a healthy and good ability, no matter how much it might feel core to current Vlad (which is not really the epitome of great game design). It's similar to old poppy and her ultimate, it was very core to her, but still not healthy for the game.

Free sustain+Damage+Point & Click is not really a good combination of things. The only counterplay to it is to not be within range.

That spell is one of the main reasons why Vlad can become a bit of a lane bully against some melee match-ups.

Also sustain have a tendency to become very uninteresting, as it works very well against minions, and with no other resources, like mana he simply pushes you out of lane. At a certain point sustain get to the point of, if you don't kill the guy in an all-in, you might as well not attack him, creating a very non-interactive situation, where both just ignore each other and attack minions instead.

"Free sustain+Damage+Point & Click is not really a good combination of things. The only counterplay to it is to not be within range." 

Agreed! It'll still do damage, heal, and be point and click, that's not changing. 

BUT!

What if, for 3 seconds after Q'ing an opponent, the opponent could fight Vladimir to get the health that he stole BACK? We're not going to do that in particular, as I don't think it fits Vlad particularly well, but my point here is there are other ways to make it fair while retaining all that other stuff.

That's....actually really clever. I'm glad that you're not adopting the default solution of turning his Q into a skillshot. It still seems like a tricky problem to solve, but I'm interested to see what you come up with. Any other ideas you want to tease? :3

Always feels to me that champions that ability revolve around health cost never have meaningful health costs. Mundo's Q being one of the biggest offenders. 

I feel if you guys make vlads other abilities actually cost a more meaningful amount of health, but still be rewarding, and Q being more of a way to recover, then it wouldn't be so bad.

Look at Aatrox. His costs are percentage. Its so bullshit that you start a fight with 15% of your hp gone. No matter how much hp you build. Unlike other hp cost champions. There's a reasons he's not played a lot, and that is one of them
Mundo's Q is actually a good example of spell with a meaningful health cost, I think. The cost of the spell is big, and you have various refund amounts depending on how well you used it.

A flat 80 health out of 4000+ hp late game, that really only costs 40 or 0 hp depending on if you hit something, and it does _20%_ of a target's current health is the definition of a spell with meaningless health cost.
Almost like it's meant to be meaningful in lane but not late game, like the resource costs for every type of resource but energy.

How about changing the amount of health gained depending on how far/close the target he hits is? 

You could add the haste here too instead of on ToB. 

Like: If you hit a target at max range you get a small amount of health and large speed boost and if you hit a target at a close range you get a large heal and a small speed boost?

That might have readability issues. If you want the heal to be important to Vlad then it is necessary that both players know how much he will get at any time he casts it.
Having the change be dynamic (to that extent) is risky. Neither player will know when they can fight.

Exciting stuff!
Will the ult be tweaked as well, or will it remain unchanged?

> [{quoted}](name=Savage Devi,realm=EUNE,application-id=A7LBtoKc,discussion-id=OJQBsbEM,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2016-03-04T22:32:25.833+0000)
>
> Exciting stuff!
> Will the ult be tweaked as well, or will it remain unchanged?

I believe Hemoplague (R) is a great candidate for changes, but we're focusing our efforts on his more moment-to-moment actions first (his base abilities), as those seem to be more at the heart of his problems and really can just be way more awesome than at present.  

Though it's not perfect, R has a unique effect and makes for some cool moments (I always enjoy getting those delayed POP!! kills), so we decided we'd look elsewhere first and tackle that one if there's some room at the end.
Opinions about his passive?

Kind of similar to the ult, actually. I find Crimson Pact to be unique and thematic, though not particularly exciting, BUT not offensive either. Accordingly, it's low on the priority list, but not off the table.
What about game health? Having one stat for free when you buy another is not particularly healthy.

I disagree with that as a general rule, as buying a stat gives more benefit than just 'damage' or just 'healing,' the question is 'of what' and 'how much.' As a simple example, AP gives Lissandra more damage and more tankiness(her R's self heal scales with AP). 

I agree that there are some unhealthy example of this, and Vlad might well be on the border there. If you get damage through buying tankiness, things can snowball out of hand very quickly as you improve both your defense AND your threat against your opponent while they only get to improve one of these. 

The trick is to build in some limiters. Looking at Vlad again, HP gives him tankiness inherently and damage through his passive and W scaling, but the %HP cost on his W makes this less abusive, since a lot of that tankiness goes out the window via his own kit. There are definitely ways to do this better or worse, and we're going to be aware of that going into it.

This is interesting to hear; I would have thought you'd need to consider any changes to the rest of his kit in the context of changes to his ult. Is it that he has an ult that doesn't impact his main gameplay patterns as much as some others do?

Hemoplague is pretty much as you say. It doesn't transform Vlad's gameplay, it just makes it better in a window (it's a damage amp!). So, changing other things on the kit and leaving that one in place turns out not to be risky, as far as we've seen.

Is the debuff component of his ultimate likely to be dropped? Looking at Vladimir I wouldn't expect him to be a support-mage. However, Warlocks, etc are traditionally debuffers in videogames, so I like the fact that enemies are crippled through his ultimate, since he kind of fits the Warlock theme.

The whole "trying to contaminate as many enemies as possible as soon as an engager sets up a teamfight for you" is very interesting, but I don't think it's explored in the best way as a short-range AOE effect that you simply drop on the ground. Thinking about Vladimir as a character, I'd rather see more strategy involved into trying to contaminate as many enemies as possible and the result to be more selfish, something like a mix between Evelynn and Trundle's ultimates - you'd steal something from your opponent and get rewarded for landing a good ult.

Reading through this made me so happy. If this is the direction you plan on taking Vladimir in, you'll have the full support of me (and hopefully other Vladimains).

If you want some other suggestions/notes that I've compiled from other Vlad players from the Boards, I made a thread for it. I'd be honoured if you checked it out.

http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/bYwf0udQ-vladimir-mains-arise-what-are-the-cores-of-our-champion

Honestly Stashu, this is as ideal a Dev Blog for Vlad as I could have imagined. Stay on the (blood) ball!

Edit: when you mention windows of power, please, please for the love of Noxus don't make him like Ryze with his power-up passive. It's a mechanic that I personally really don't enjoy, and what a lot of people love about Vlad is how consistent his sustain/damage is, not in sporadic bursts.

Will Vladimir and some of the more dated mages that are being reworked receive updated ability icons, even for the abilities that aren't being removed? Some, like Vlad's and Malzahar's, are pretty dated.
The plan for Vladimir is to get all new icons! But we're not going to hold up his release if something falls through there, of course.
Any plans to make his legendary skin feel like a legendary skin? (other than the VO and darker blood)

Are any changes to his mobility and ranges considered? 
Some basic movement speed would help to make Movement Speed Quints less compelling for Vladimir.

Not specifically, but we agree that currently most of what Vlad has to do to be successful is simply be in range of the opponent, and so this reallllly favors MS quints. We'd like to change this dependency, so there's a solid chance we add a haste somewhere; but as there are multiple ways to solve this, no promises!

One thing that appears to not be brought up here that I've always enjoyed about Vlad is how good he is at diving into an entire team. His ult, his pool, a stacked-up E... you all get the best pay off for these spells by hitting multiple people with them, especially his E. I feel like this aspect of Vlad is actually what's helped keep his Q unchanged for so long; it may be a boring spell on paper, but by being Vlad's only single-target spell, it stands out on his otherwise teamfight-oriented kit.

Even if this involved toning down his dueling abilities, is Vlad's "the more the merrier" aspect something you intend to hone in on a little more specifically, or is Vlad's preferred fighting space something you are okay with not putting too much thought into and instead seeing what happens with his changes? Not that that would be a bad thing - if Vlad is being changed along the guidelines you just listed above, I'm completely fine with whatever fight styles he ends up being best at.

Agreed- one of Vlad's higher moments at present in W'ing through the front line, R'ing the whole team and smashing them with a 'big' E. We plan to keep this general pattern, and E's AoE nature is core to it. The changes we're looking at are focused more on redefining what 'big' means and how to get it.

Thank you so much for considering {{champion:8}} for this update and I am certainly looking forward to a smoother and more clear gameplay on him, possibly combined with more competitive strength.
What I absolutely want to accentuate on is, *please* do this well. Vladimir is one of the most iconic champions of this game and has kept many old players, including me, coming back to it. He has a solid playerbase which loves what he stands for, his aesthetics and the fun and distinct gameplay he has. So please give this update the attention it deserves.

EDIT: A thing I personally love about Vlad is how anti-assassin he can be if played right in the midlane. I hope the update doesn't change this as my primary sustenance as a Vlad main is blood AND assassin tears.
Hey! About that assassin point, I believe his W is his main advantage there. Are there other aspects of the kit you find critical in his assassin matchups?

Hey, thanks for replying! You are correct that his pool is is primary anti-assassin tool, because if timed right it can help dodge many combos and the particularly obnoxious Zed ultimate (also the heal on it helps at times, if you move under a minion wave while pooling).
There are also a few additional aspects of his kit  - e.g. he's already somewhat tanky when most assassins start cheesing (I manage to back for a cheap defensive item before the BIG ASSASSIN ULT CHEESE and it usually saves me). The stat conversion helps greatly in justifying starting with a defensive item (eg Spectre's against a LeBlanc).
Another main point is that if Vlad survives an assassin combo, he can then regenerate most of his missing health while the enemy still has their cooldowns up. But I doubt you will change any of this.
What mildly worried me is that you mentioned adding counterplay to the healing on Q. Depending on how you balance it, this might make such counterplay easily within the reach of squishy mobile opponents or not so much. A large part of Vlad's ability to deal with assassins at present lies in his easy trades once he survives the burst and it goes without saying that the ability to easily negate the healing he gains will take that away.

Gotcha! Thanks for the breakdown. I'll try to keep a close eye on his assassin matchups in development, but I hope this eases your mind: we plan on keeping W pretty much identical, maintaining his best-in-class lane sustain, and encouraging high HP builds [for a mage].

I dont think Assassins are really as big of a problem as Vlad than powerful close range mages like LB, Ryze and Cassiopeia, against those you pretty much cant do anything but just stay outside their range.
I wasn't saying assassins are a problem for Vlad, just that he's my go-to pick when I see an assassin mid on the enemy team.

His large innate health really helps preventing to be bursted down, due to him being a 0 mana caster he is also capable of obtaining defensive itemization quickly, combined with his pool those would be the main reasons.

I just wanna stop by and say thanks. As Vlad main I went from being apprehensive to excited for the rework just from the few things said here, it feels like you guys really understand both Vladimir and what his players enjoy about him.
